areaSection: Javea, nestled on the northernmost point of the Costa Blanca, occupies a distinctive peninsula that projects into the Mediterranean, creating a dramatically different geography from its southern neighbours. The town combines genuine Spanish authenticity with cosmopolitan European sensibilities, distinguished by its three distinct beaches and dramatic rocky coves that characterize the local landscape. The region enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with a temperate Mediterranean climate moderated by sea breezes, creating perfect conditions for year-round outdoor living. Javea has maintained its character as a traditional fishing village while modernizing selectively, preserving narrow winding streets and authentic plazas in the old town. The surrounding countryside features pine forests and agricultural land that prevent overdevelopment, maintaining the area's unspoiled character. This unique positioning—close enough to Valencia and Alicante for urban amenities, yet sufficiently remote to preserve tranquility—has attracted a sophisticated international demographic seeking authentic Mediterranean living rather than resort tourism.
lifestyleSection: Life in Javea revolves around a more measured Mediterranean rhythm that appeals particularly to those seeking an alternative to coastal tourism hubs. The established British, German, and Dutch expatriate communities have created a welcoming environment where international residents seamlessly integrate while maintaining the area's Spanish character. Daily living involves easy access to pristine beaches, excellent local restaurants serving fresh Mediterranean cuisine, and vibrant weekly markets offering seasonal produce. Healthcare facilities include the modern Hospital de Dénia just 15 minutes away with numerous English-speaking medical professionals, addressing a key concern for international residents. The town supports excellent international schools including Xàbia International College offering British curriculum education, making it particularly attractive for families. Leisure activities span from water sports and coastal walks to golf at Jávea Golf Club, while the established expat infrastructure means finding services, from property maintenance to financial advice, in English. The proximity to Dénia's ferry terminal provides regular connections to Ibiza and Mallorca, enabling weekend escapes without lengthy travel.
investmentSection: Costa Blanca property values have appreciated consistently at approximately 6% year-on-year, reflecting sustained demand from both European buyers and Spanish nationals. This villa's pricing at the Javea market average of €3,200 per square meter positions it favorably within the regional investment landscape. The short-term rental market generates substantial income potential, with comparable properties achieving €1,400 weekly rates during peak season, translating to approximately 18-20% annual gross yields for properties rented 6-7 months annually. Javea distinguishes itself from other Costa Blanca destinations through its preservation of authentic character while maintaining modern amenities, creating sustained appeal across economic cycles. Unlike southern coastal areas subject to tourism volatility, Javea's mature international residential community provides stable demand, particularly from buyers aged 45+ seeking relocation and second home purchases. The property's location within an established gated community enhances both security and resale value, appealing to conservative buyers prioritizing capital preservation alongside income generation.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in Javea represents a sophisticated investment opportunity combining Mediterranean authenticity, established international community, and compelling economic fundamentals. The €1,749,000 pricing at market-average valuation provides immediate value for discerning buyers seeking permanent relocation or premium second residence within Europe's most desirable coastal region. The property's 57 professional images document every detail, enabling confident decision-making for international purchasers. With strong rental income potential, consistent capital appreciation, and comprehensive lifestyle amenities, this villa delivers the balance of investment security and Mediterranean quality that distinguishes Javea within the luxury Costa Blanca market. healthcare.text: Healthcare access represents a primary consideration for international property buyers, and Javea provides reassuring options. Hospital de Dénia, just 15 minutes away, offers comprehensive acute care with English-speaking staff, supplemented by numerous private clinics throughout the region. English-speaking general practitioners operate through local health centres, and residents benefit from Spain's high-quality, cost-effective healthcare system. Emergency services respond efficiently throughout the municipality, with modern ambulance stations strategically positioned. Many international residents maintain private health insurance while accessing both Spanish public healthcare and private facilities, ensuring continuity with international standards.

education.text: Families relocating to Javea benefit from several international school options maintaining high academic standards. Xàbia International College, just 5 minutes away, follows the British curriculum from primary through secondary levels, offering familiar educational progression for British families. Laude Lady Elizabeth School provides additional international education options within 20 minutes. Spanish public schools in the area maintain good reputations for students seeking Spanish language immersion. The established international community means extensive peer networks exist for school selection and integration support.

shopping.text: Daily shopping meets international standards with major supermarkets including Mercadona, Consum, and Masymas strategically located throughout the municipality. The British Corner Shop caters specifically to expatriate requirements, stocking familiar brands and specialty items. Weekly markets in Javea town centre and neighboring areas offer fresh produce, seafood, and local specialties at authentic prices. Larger shopping centres in Benidorm (25 minutes) and Dénia (15 minutes) provide additional retail options for significant purchases. The combination of Spanish markets and international retailers means residents access both authentic local products and familiar international brands.

transport.text: Javea's location on the northeast coast positions it conveniently between major transport hubs while maintaining relative isolation from high-volume tourism corridors. Alicante International Airport, 85 minutes away via well-maintained motorway, connects to major European cities with multiple daily flights. Local bus services to Dénia, Valencia, and Alicante provide public transport alternatives. Dénia ferry terminal (12 minutes) offers summer connections to Ibiza and Mallorca for weekend escapes. For daily living, private vehicle ownership enables flexibility, though the compact town centre remains walkable for essential services.
